issue.title: Inherit "disabled" attribute in internally rendered hidden fields in checkbox, radio, etc.
issue.body:
This PR fix bug, when CHtml render active hidden filed for disabled checbox or radio buttons.

``` php
echo CHtml::activeCheckBox($model, 'active', array('disabled' => true));
```

issue.title: Disabled activeCheckbox doesn't disable the hidden checkbox pair so values are always reset

labels.name: status:ready for adoption
labels.description: Feel free to implement this issue.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Use similar code:
```
$model->show_full_text = true;
Html::activeCheckbox($model, 'show_full_text', ['disabled' => true]);
```
This creates the following HTML:
```
<input type="hidden" name="Nutrient[show_full_text]" value="0">
<label style="margin-bottom:0">
    <input type="checkbox" id="nutrient-show_full_text" name="Nutrient[show_full_text]" value="1" checked disabled">
    Show full text
</label>
```

### What is the expected result?

The hidden input should be also disabled.

### What do you get instead?

The hidden input is not disabled. When the form is submitted, the disabled input is correctly ignored and the hidden value is submitted, i.e. the appropriate value will be always resetted.

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.15.1
| PHP version      | 7.1
| Operating system | Ubuntu 16.04
